author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Chennai Corporation has informed the Madras High Court that efforts will be taken to demolish all the old and dilapidated buildings in Gorge Town area within three months.

Counsel for the Corporation made the submission on a contempt application from activist ‘Traffic’ Ramaswamy which came up before the First Bench of Chief Justice S.K Kaul and Justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana on Thursday.

Mr. Ramaswamy had filed a PIL to demolish the old buildings, which posed threat to the public and the bench by an order dated October 7 last year held that if the building owners agree for the demolition and offer to bear the cost, the corporation officials can proceed with the demolition work.

Thereafter, alleging that the Corporation Commissioner had not taken any action despite a court order, Ramaswamy filed the present contempt petition.

When the petition came up for hearing, the corporation submitted that it would take all the necessary steps to demolish the buildings and stated that there was no cooperation from the police.

But the government pleader assured that the police officials will render all necessary assistance for the Corporation officials to perform their duties.

The corporation then submitted that the exercise would be completed within three months.
title: Corporation seeks three months to demolish buildings in George Town
